descriptions: Teams net points while player is on the court.
Teams net points while player is on the court.

article.description:
Alvin Williams scored 20 points, including
four in the final 40 seconds, and handed out eight assists to lead
the short-handed Toronto Raptors to a 92-87 victory Sunday over the
Memphis Grizzlies.
article.headline: Raptors' late 8-0 run enough to earn win
article.linkText: Raptors pull away from Grizzlies down the stretch
article.story:
MEMPHIS, Tenn. -- The Toronto Raptors were in trouble until they took over in the final minutes.
Williams

Alvin Williams scored 20 points, including four in the final 40 seconds, and handed out eight assists to lead the short-handed Raptors to a 92-87 victory Sunday over the Memphis Grizzlies. Vince Carter scored 27 points to lead Toronto, which outscored Memphis 8-0 down the stretch. "We kept our focus for 48 minutes, regardless of how bad we played,'' Carter said. "We missed some good looks, but yet our heads were still in the game. Guys didn't put their head down. We were still trying to fight and still trying to win.'' Williams' layup with 38.3 seconds to play gave the Raptors an 88-87 lead. He added two free throws with 15.5 seconds remaining as Memphis failed to score in the final 2:42. Carter sealed the game on a breakaway dunk with 2 seconds left. Antonio Davis scored 14 points and grabbed 12 rebounds. Toronto won its second straight after a six-game losing streak. Memphis has dropped two straight. The Raptors, who got Carter back three games ago from a strained quadriceps, still dressed only nine players. They appeared in trouble throughout, but put together an offensive burst at the end. "We don't quit, we make good things happen,'' Toronto coach Lenny Wilkins said. "I'm glad it's over, and that we won.'' Reserve forward Michael Bradley, Toronto's first-round draft choice in 2001, finished with eight points and nine rebounds in 23 minutes. "This was Michael Bradley's night,'' Carter said. "He was the big key ... When we can have guys like (Bradley) play like he did on both ends of the floor, that's a big positive.'' Memphis coach Hubie Brown was disappointed in the Raptors' 47-43 advantage on the boards, especially Toronto's 14 offensive rebounds. He said his team's inability to pull away when it was playing well in the first half set the stage for the Raptors' comeback. "We had an eight-point lead, but there was no execution from our group,'' Brown said. "It was one of those days when the energy is there, and then it's not. From three minutes left in the fourth quarter, we didn't get the job done.'' Shane Battier led the Grizzlies with 14 points and eight rebounds, while Jason Williams and Pau Gasol finished with 11 each. Gasol had 10 rebounds. Memphis led 46-37 at the half after a sluggish performance by both teams. The Raptors shot 35.4 percent from the field in the half, while the Grizzlies hit 42 percent. "It was an ugly game,'' Bradley said. "Both teams were out of sync. It was just going to be a matter of keep plugging away. We kept fighting and clawing our way back into it and stayed close. Finally, in the fourth quarter, we finally got over the hump.'' Game notes
Toronto's Voshon Lenard missed his first game of the season with a strained back. ... Morris Peterson and Alvin Williams are the only Raptors to start every game. ... The Raptors' 37 points were the lowest by a Grizzlies opponent in the first half this season. ... Memphis' Gordan Giricek was 2-of-2 from the free-throw line. He has hit 37 of his last 38, including 10 straight. ... Toronto holds a 9-5 advantage in the series.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
